item.title: How Did We Count Before We Invented Numbers?
Why are the Most Common Verbs Irregular?
item.description: Why are the Most Common Verbs Irregular? Recently, I was wondering something that most romance language learners probably wonder at some point–why the hell are there so many irregular verb conjugations in this language? And why are they so weird (See: Portuguese Subjunctive of the verb ‘ser’)? And why, oh why, do they always happen with the most commonly used verbs (e.g. ’to want’, ’to do’, ’to say’, ’to be’)? It’s like someone purposely designed Portuguese to be hard to learn.
